Yes, it's important to properly cool down after an intense yoga session to allow your body to relax and recover. Here are some yoga poses that you can try to cool down after your practice:

1. Seated Forward Bend (Paschimottanasana)
2. Reclining Bound Angle pose (Supta Baddha Konasana)
3. Supported Shoulder Stand (Salamba Sarvangasana)
4. Legs Up the Wall Pose (Viparita Karani)
5. Supine Spinal Twist (Supta Matsyendrasana)

You can also try some restorative yoga poses like Yoga Nidra, also known as yogic sleep, which is a guided relaxation technique that helps to calm the mind and body. Deep breathing with pranayama techniques like Brahmari and Shitali Pranayama can also help to cool down your body and mind. Remember to always listen to your body and take the time to recover after an intense practice. Cooling down after your practice will help you to fully reap the benefits of your yoga session, and leave you feeling calm, rejuvenated, and centered.
